name: All the Wasted Time Multiple Choice Quiz | Musicals | 10 Questions

questions.text: Who played Leo Frank in the original Broadway cast?
questions.explanation:
Brent Carver.

	Brent Carver has also been seen in the original Broadway cast of "Kiss of the Spider-Woman". He won a Tony for his role and was nominated for a Tony in "Parade". "Kiss of the Spider-Woman" ran from May 3, 1993 to July 1, 1995.

questions.text: Which character(s) sings "All The Wasted Time"?
questions.explanation:
Leo and Lucille Frank.

	Lucille Frank is Leo's wife and was originally played by Carolee Carmello. Carmello has also been seen in "Lestat", which ran from April 25, 2006 to May 28, 2006. She won a Drama Desk award for "Parade".

questions.text: Which character did John Hickok play?
questions.explanation:
Governor Slaton.

	Slaton sings "Pretty Music". Hickok has also been seen as Zoser in "Aida" and as Professor Bhaer in "Little Women".  "Aida" ran from March 23, 2000 to September 5, 2004. "Little Women" ran from January 23, 2005 to May 22, 2005.

questions.text: Leo Frank is accused of murdering a little girl. What was her name?
questions.explanation:
Mary Phagan.

	The story of Leo Frank is real. Frank was accused of killing a child who worked in his factory, Mary Phagan. There was no evidence, but a scapegoat was needed.

questions.text: Why is Leo Frank shunned in Atlanta?
questions.explanation:
He is Jewish.

	Atlanta did not have a large Jewish population in the early 1900's. Anti-Semitism and ignorance led to Leo Frank's wrongful conviction and death. Mary Phagan was an employee of Frank's, she worked in his pencil factory.

questions.text: In which Georgia town did the girl die, and how far is it from Atlanta?
questions.correct: Marietta is twenty miles from Atlanta
options: Milledgeville is twelve miles from Atlanta
Milledgeville is five miles from Atlanta
Milledgeville is ten miles from Atlanta
questions.explanation:
Marietta is twenty miles from Atlanta.

	Milledgeville is where Leo Frank is tried, not Marietta. Marietta is where Mary Phagan lived, and where Frank is lynched.

questions.text: What occupation does Newt Lee have?
questions.explanation:
Night watchman.

	Newt Lee is the night watchman at the factory in which Mary Phagan works and which Leo owns. He later testifies against Frank in the murder trial.

questions.text: Which character was the state prosecutor in the murder trial?
questions.explanation:
Hugh Dorsey.

	Dorsey was originally played by Herndon Lackey, who was also in "Kiss of the Spider-Woman" with Brent Carver, who played Leo Frank. Dorsey sings "Somethin' Ain't Right" and "Twenty Miles From Marietta".

questions.text: The judge who writes a letter to the governor of Atlanta is named Judge Roan.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Judge Roan sings his "Letter to the Governor", expressing his doubts over Leo Frank's guilt. This letter finally convinces Governor Slaton to sentence Frank to life imprisonment, not death. Roan was originally played on Broadway by Don Chastain, who died in 2002.

questions.text: Complete this lyric from "This is Not Over Yet": "It means that Dorsey can stop beaming/ And my __________ can stop dreaming of his portion of my estate."
questions.explanation:
cousin.

	Leo Frank sings "This is Not Over Yet" when his case takes a turn for the better and he realizes that he can't fight this battle without his wife Lucille.
